metadata.title: CVE-2022-0213 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
vim is vulnerable to Heap-based Buffer Overflow

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0213` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm9
vim-athena - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm9
vim-common - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm9
vim-gnome - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm9
vim-gtk - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm9
vim-gui-common - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm9
vim-lesstif - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm9
vim-nox - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm9
vim-runtime - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm9
vim-tiny - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: vim package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm9').
